common.disablesUseToSwitchSpace: Switching space from console is not allowed by current role
common.spaceTip: Only required when you need to execute queries in a specified space.
common.name: Name

doc.schemaIntro: You can use the Schema page to operate graph spaces in Nebula Graph
doc.importIntro: You can use the Import page to batch import vertex and edge data into Nebula Graph for graph exploration and data analysis.
doc.consoleIntro: When data is imported, you can use the Console page to query graph data.
doc.useGuideTip: Learn how to use Nebula Studio
doc.ngqlIntroTip: nGQL is a declarative graph query language for Nebula Graph. It allows expressive and efficient graph patterns.

warning.connectError: Connection refused, please configure server again

formRules.nodeIdError:
The format is invalid, should be one node per line, split by \n like: 
id1
id2
id3
formRules.nameValidate: The name must start with a letter, and it only supports English letters, numbers and underscores
formRules.replicaLimit: Replica factor must not exceed the number of your current online machines({number})
formRules.ttlRequired: Please select the corresponding property, and the data type of the property must be integer or timestamp
formRules.fixedStringLength: Fixed String length must be a positive integer

console.exportVertex: Please choose the column representing vertex IDs from the table
console.exportEdge: Please choose the columns representing source vertex ID, destination vertex ID, and rank of an edge

explore.clearTip: Are you sure to proceed the cleanup of the renderred graph view?
explore.importPlaceholder:
Enter VIDs or other data for VID generation, one data per line, and split them by pressing the Enter key. Here is an example:
string1
string2
string3
explore.selectReminder: The selection of space will cleanup the renderred graph view, are you sure to proceed?
explore.indexQueryPrompt_suffix: space, no tag indexes are found, so query by index is not available.
explore.indexQueryPrompt2: Please create indexes on the tags. Here is an example:
explore.indexLink: For more information about index, see its
explore.operationConfirm: This Delete operation will clear the following fields. Are you sure you want to continue the operation?
explore.customQueryDescription: Enter the statements in the console. When the results are returned, click the Open in Explore button as shown in the preceding figure to explore the graph.
explore.insertMethodSelect: How do you like to render the new data with the existing graph view, incrementally or wipe the graph view first?
explore.indexConditionDescription: To use a composite index for a query, we should either filter all fields or the left matching contiguous fields in sequence. That is, the first field is mandatory and skipping field is not allowed
explore.timestampInput: Only numbers are supported for the timestamp field
explore.pretreatmentExplaination: Hash can pre-process data of the bool, double, int, or string type to generate VIDs, but UUID can pre-process data of the string type only. To generate VIDs by pre-processing strings, enclose each string with single or double quotes.
explore.toBlobError: Export failed. The current canvas size is too large. Please zoom out to retry.
explore.expandTip: Double-click any vertex to explore its related vertices and edges.
explore.searchTip: The following comparison operators are currently supported [=, >, <, !=, <>, <=, >=]
explore.expandTips: Double-click the vertex to quickly expand according to the current configuration by default
explore.emptyIndexTips: No attribute index currently does not support the data query function in Explore, Please select index with attribute for query

import.mountPathPlaceholder: Please input the docker data mount path
import.mappingTip: The index of the csv file
import.setVertexIdTip: Set current prop as vertex id
import.setSrcTip: Set field's value as edge source id
import.setDstTip: Set field's value as edge destination id
import.setRankTip: Set field's value as edge rank
import.importErrorInfo: Error importing data. Please check the configuration or data file
import.mountPathWarning: Import data need to config the WORKING_DIR env variable before starting.
import.importMappingError: The data file configuration map import failed
import.importFormatError: Data file format is not uniform
import.enterPassword: Please enter your nebula account password
import.uploadTemplate: Click or drag the yaml configuration file to this area to upload
import.uploadTemplateTip: Please keep only the file name (retain the file extension) for all file paths in the template, such as logPath: config.csv
import.fileUploadRequired: Make sure all csv data files are uploaded before uploading the configuration

schema.useSpaceErrTip: Space not found. Trying to use a newly created graph space may fail because the creation is implemented asynchronously. To make sure the follow-up operations work as expected, Wait for two heartbeat cycles, i.e., 20 seconds.
schema.partitionNumDescription: partition_num specifies the number of partitions in one replica. The default value is 100. It is usually 5 times the number of hard disks in the cluster.
schema.replicaFactorDescription: replica_factor specifies the number of replicas in the cluster. The default replica factor is 1. The suggested number is 3 in cluster. It is usually 3 in production. Due to the majority voting principle, it must set to be odd.
schema.charsetDescription: charset is short for character set. A character set is a set of symbols and encodings. The default value is utf8.
schema.collateDescription: A collation is a set of rules for comparing characters in a character set. The default value is utf8_bin.
schema.vidTypeDescription: Specifies the data type of vertex IDs (VIDs) in a graph space.
schema.cancelOperation: Do you want to close this panel
schema.cancelPropmt: If you close the panel, the configuration will be deleted automatically. Are you sure that you want to close the panel?
schema.fieldDisabled: A TTL configuration is set for this property, so it cannot be edited. If you want to edit this property, delete the TTL configuration.
schema.fieldRequired: Property name and its data type are required
schema.indexExist: An index exists, so TTL configuration is not permitted. A tag or edge type cannot have both an index and TTL configuration.
schema.indexedLengthDescription: Set the indexed string length. If you are indexing fixed strings, you must not set this option.
schema.indexedLengthRequired: Indexed length must be a positive integer
schema.leavePage: Whether to leave the current page?
schema.leavePagePrompt: You have unsaved changes to the record on this tab. If you leave this tab without saving the changes, they will be lost. Are you sure that you want to leave?
schema.timestampFormat:
Supported data inserting methods:
1. call function now()
2. call function timestamp(), for example: timestamp('2021-07-05T06:18:43.984000')
3. Input the timestamp directly, namely the number of seconds from 1970-01-01 00:00:00
schema.dateFormat:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function date(), for example: date('2021-03-17')
schema.timeFormat:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function time(), for example: time('17:53:59')
schema.datetimeFormat:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function datetime(), for example: datetime('2021-03-17T17:53:59')
schema.geographyFormat:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function ST_GeogFromText(), for example:ST_GeogFromText('POINT(6 10)')
schema.geography(point)Format:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function ST_GeogFromText('POINT()'), for example:ST_GeogFromText('POINT(6 10)')
schema.geography(linestring)Format:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function ST_GeogFromText('LINESTRING()'), for example:ST_GeogFromText('LINESTRING(3 4,10 50,20 25)')
schema.geography(polygon)Format:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function ST_GeogFromText('POLYGON()'), for example:ST_GeogFromText('POLYGON((1 1,5 1,5 5,1 5,1 1),(2 2,2 3,3 3,3 2,2 2))')
schema.durationFormat:
Supported data inserting methods:
Call function duration(), for example:duration({years: 1, seconds: 0})
